name: Durock V2 Stabilizers
notes: Gold-plated screw-in stabilizers. Community favorite for smooth, rattle-free performance.

name: C3 Equalz V3 Stabilizers
notes: Tight housing tolerances with minimal wire rattle out of the box. Available in multiple colorways.

name: TX Stabilizers Rev 3
notes: Revised design with tighter stem-to-housing fit. Excellent wire balance and minimal tick.

name: Cherry Clip-In Stabilizers
notes: OEM Cherry plate-mount clip-in stabilizers. Budget-friendly and widely compatible with most tray-mount boards.

name: Gateron Ink V2 Stabilizers
notes: Smoky translucent housing with tight tolerances. Great stock performance with minimal modding needed.

name: Owlab Stabilizers
notes: Premium stabilizers from the Spring and Jelly Epoch designer. Exceptionally tight tolerances and balanced wires.

name: Staebies V2 Stabilizers
notes: Unique split-stem design eliminates wire pop-out. No-mod-needed approach for hassle-free builds.

name: WS Morandi Stabilizers
notes: Solid budget-to-mid-range stabilizers with consistent quality. Available in muted Morandi colorways.

name: TX Long Springs 63.5g
notes: 110-count long springs for a smoother force curve. 63.5g bottom-out weight, great for linears.

name: TX Long Springs 55g
notes: 110-count long springs at a lighter 55g bottom-out. Ideal for those who prefer a featherweight typing feel.

name: SPRiT Slow Extreme Springs 68g
notes: Progressive slow-curve springs that start light and ramp up gradually. Reduces finger fatigue over long sessions.

name: Thic Thock DL Series Springs 62g
notes: Dual-stage long springs with a distinctive two-phase force curve. Smooth bottom-out feel.

name: Geon Raptor Springs 65g
notes: High-quality Korean-made springs. Consistent weight across the pack with minimal spring ping.

name: Durock Gold-Plated Springs 67g
notes: Budget gold-plated springs that resist corrosion. Decent consistency for the price point.

name: Krytox 205g0
notes: The gold standard lube for linear switches. Thick enough to dampen scratchiness without making switches sluggish. 5ml vial.

name: Krytox 105 Oil
notes: Thin oil ideal for springs to eliminate ping. Also used to thin 205g0 for tactile switches. 5ml vial.

name: Tribosys 3203
notes: Thin semi-fluid grease. The go-to for tactile switches since it preserves the bump while reducing scratch. 5ml vial.

name: Tribosys 3204
notes: Medium-viscosity grease sitting between 3203 and 205g0. Versatile for both linear and tactile applications. 5ml vial.

name: Kelowna Lube Station Kit
notes: All-in-one lube kit with 5ml Krytox 205g0, brush set, stem holder, and 30-switch lube station tray.

name: GPL 106
notes: Thicker PFPE oil alternative to Krytox 105. Excellent for bag-lubing springs to eliminate ping. 5ml vial.

name: Deskeys Switch Films
notes: Gasket-style films made from a rubbery material. Reduce housing wobble and deepen switch sound. 120-pack.

name: TX Switch Films
notes: Thin polycarbonate films that tighten housing fit. Available in multiple thicknesses. 110-pack.

name: Kelowna Switch Films
notes: Budget-friendly HTV films with good thickness tolerance. Available in 0.125mm and 0.3mm. 120-pack.

name: Durock Switch Films
notes: Soft poron-like switch films. Good dampening effect and reduces housing rattle. 110-pack.

name: KBDfans Switch Films
notes: Basic polycarbonate switch films. Affordable way to tighten up loose housings. 120-pack.

name: Stupidfish Case Foam
notes: Custom-cut case foam for popular keyboard kits. Reduces case ping and hollowness. Board-specific cuts available.

name: KBDfans PE Foam Sheet
notes: Thin PE foam sheet placed between PCB and switches for a poppy, creamy sound signature. Cut to fit.

name: Plate Foam Cut (Universal)
notes: EVA plate foam placed between the plate and PCB. Dampens vibrations and fills the gap for a quieter build.

name: PORON Case Foam Sheet
notes: High-quality PORON foam sheet. Cut to size for any keyboard case. Superior density and vibration absorption.

name: Silicone Pour Dampener Kit
notes: Two-part silicone poured directly into the case cavity. Cures to a dense pad that eliminates all case resonance.

name: KiiBoss Switch Opener
notes: CNC aluminum switch opener compatible with Cherry MX and Kailh-style switches. One-hand operation.

name: Wire Keycap Puller
notes: Stainless steel wire keycap puller. Safer for keycaps than plastic ring-style pullers. Essential for any build.

name: Kailh Switch Puller
notes: Plastic switch puller designed for hot-swap sockets. Compresses the clips on both sides for safe switch removal.

name: Lube Station 30-Switch
notes: Acrylic lube station holding 30 switch stems upright. Makes the lubing process organized and efficient.

name: Stem Holder
notes: 4-prong stem holder for applying lube to switch stems precisely. Keeps fingers clean and speeds up the process.

name: Precision Tweezers Set
notes: 6-piece ESD-safe precision tweezer set. Useful for placing switch films, handling small screws, and general build work.

name: Pinecil V2 Soldering Iron Kit
notes: Compact USB-C powered soldering iron. Heats up in seconds, supports multiple tips. Perfect for soldering switches and LEDs.

name: 72-Switch Tester
notes: 72-switch sample board with keycaps included. Try Cherry, Gateron, Kailh, and more before committing to a full set.

name: Mechcables Coiled Aviator USB-C Cable
notes: Custom coiled cable with GX16 aviator connector and USB-C device end. Hand-coiled and reverse-coiled for tight memory.

name: CableMod Pro Coiled Keyboard Cable
notes: Pro-grade coiled cable with tight coil memory. Available in dozens of color options. Aviator or LEMO-style connector.

name: Space Cables Lemo-Style Coiled Cable
notes: Premium coiled cable featuring a push-pull LEMO-style connector. Clean aesthetic and reliable detach mechanism.

name: Zap Cables Custom Coiled Cable
notes: Fully custom coiled cable with color-matched paracord and techflex. YC8 or aviator connector options.

name: Straight USB-C Braided Cable
notes: No-frills braided nylon USB-C cable. Reliable data and power delivery without the coiled cable premium.

name: Randomfrankp x NovelKeys Desk Mat
notes: Minimalist dark desk mat collab between Randomfrankp and NovelKeys. Stitched edges, smooth cloth surface.

name: NovelKeys Desk Mat
notes: Large-format desk mat available in a rotating selection of community-designed colorways. Dye-sublimated print.

name: CannonKeys Winter Landscape Desk Mat
notes: Scenic winter landscape art printed on a full-size desk mat. Part of CannonKeys seasonal artist series.

name: Omnitype Great Wave Desk Mat
notes: Hokusai Great Wave reinterpretation desk mat. Premium dye-sub print with vibrant colors and non-slip rubber base.

name: Grovemade Matte Desk Pad
notes: Premium vegetable-tanned leather desk pad with a matte finish. Ages beautifully with a unique patina over time.

name: Glorious Wooden Wrist Rest TKL
notes: Solid onyx-stained hardwood wrist rest sized for TKL keyboards. Smooth lacquer finish with rubber feet.

name: Royal Glam Wood Wrist Rest 60%
notes: Handcrafted walnut wood wrist rest for 60% boards. Ergonomic angle and oil-finished surface.

name: Grovemade Leather Wrist Rest
notes: Full-grain leather over a contoured hardwood base. Develops a rich patina over months of use.

name: Razer Ergonomic Wrist Rest
notes: Memory foam wrist rest with cooling gel layer and anti-slip rubber base. Full-size length.

name: KBDfans Keyboard Carrying Case 60%
notes: Hard-shell carrying case with custom foam insert for 60% keyboards. Protects during travel and storage.

name: KBDfans Keyboard Carrying Case 65%
notes: Hard-shell travel case sized for 65% layouts including boards like the Tofu65 and KBD67 Lite.

name: Keychron Keyboard Travel Pouch
notes: Soft padded travel pouch fits most 65%-75% keyboards. Water-resistant exterior with plush interior lining.

name: Acrylic Keyboard Dust Cover (TKL)
notes: Clear acrylic dust cover for TKL keyboards. Keeps dust and debris off your board when not in use.
